titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John H. Taylor, Transcript
CWG4652

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
1
Fayette Circuit Court,
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
John H Taylor f M C

The Grand Jury of Fayette County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John H Taylor, free man of color of the crime of Grand Larceny committed as follows, viz; The said John H Taylor on the 1st day of February 1864, in the County aforesaid, feloniously took and carried away Four Barrels of Corn the personal property of Caleb Tarlton of the value of more than Four dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

And the Grand Jurors of the County aforesaid, in the name and by the authority aforesaid, further accuse the said John H Taylor of the crime of Receiving stolen property, knowing that the same was stolen, committed as follows, towit: The said John H Taylor on the 1st day of February 1864, in the County aforesaid, did receive Four Barrels of Corn the personal property of Caleb Tarlton, knowing at the time that he received Corn that it was stolen, said Corn so received was worth over Four dollars, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Witnesses:
Caleb Tarleton
James Keizer
John Stevenson
M H Cromwell
A J Gorham
E C Gorham

Returned into Court February 10th 1864.
Amount of Bail Bond $800.
(And afterwards, towit: at a Court continued and held in and for the Circuit aforesaid, on the 22nd day of Feby 1864.)

2
The Commonwealth came by her Attorney and the Defendant was called and failed to appear in discharge of his Bail Bond herein.
W L Taylor surety of said Defendant was likewise called who failed to produce the body of his prinicpal.
Wherefore it is ordered that the Bail Bond herein be and the same is hereby forfeited and that a Summons issue thereon in the name of the Commonwealth returnable to the next term.
(And afterwards, towit: at a Court continued and held in and for the Circuit aforesaid, on the 6th day of February 1865.)
On motion of the Attorney for the Plaintiff, it is ordered that this case be filed away with leave to reinstate the same on the Docket at anytime hereafter.

True Copies -- Att Jno B Norton C f C C
By Chas F Lowry D C

Comth Kentucky
vs. } Copy Indict &c
Taylor John H
For Wm L Taylor
